resources.string: Select what you would like to include:
It looks like &APP_NAME; has crashed. Tap “%1$s” to save a report to a location of your choice. You can use this report to report a new issue on the project website.
You can now visit the project page on Github and log a new issue. Please attach the previously saved report to the issue. If you don’t have a Github account yet, you will need to create one.
Couldn’t communicate with the server. Try again later.
The connection to the server timed out.
An unexpected error has occurred. If the problem persists, contact support via the “%1$s” option at the bottom of the settings page.
Upgrading from versions older than %1$s is not supported.
The certificate is invalid or inaccessible.
There was a network problem while accessing %1$s. Please check if the website is up, and if the problem persists please contact support.
Access was blocked by the website.
Please check that storage is accessible.
Please check that storage is writable, and has sufficient space.
Please open the Settings and check your network and Search Site preferences.\nAlso check your device network settings.
There was a connection problem to the service on “%1$s”.
The selected file is not recognized.
The selected file cannot be imported.
The archive file is corrupt or otherwise invalid.
File must contain a column with one of the following names: %1$s
Record must contain a field named “%1$s”.

WARNING: Importing data may update existing book records with new information if the UUID column is not present and the ID in the import file is the same as an existing ID. This is usually fine if you changed a field in an exported file. If you created a new book record, or are importing someone else’s books, ensure the UUID field is present or the ID field is blank.
Unable to find the specified book.
Not all sites returned valid data.
No valid search data for active sites.
WARNING: Saved changes are instantly applied to all books.
Enable at least one website for each category.
Select at least one field to update.
At least one field must not be blank.
This action requires a valid ISBN.
Select a site and enter an id.
If a day is specified, then both month and year must be specified.
If a month is specified, then a year must also be specified.
Please confirm that these titles are (mostly) correct.
Would you like to backup your database to your sdcard?
WARNING: none of the currently selected sites supports searching by %1$s. Please use the site menu to enable alternative sites, or use a different search method.
The date reading started, is after the end date
Must be blank or an existing Author
“%1$s” is present in a single book:\n\n%2$s
All books on this shelf have covers
Tap on a thumbnail to display a larger image.
Tap on the larger image to select it.
Calibre Content Server extension is not installed. Virtual libraries will not be available.
(only supported by the ISFDB web site)
Dutch and more; Catalogue; European Comics
English and more; Catalogue; Fantasy and Science Fiction
French and more; Catalogue; European Comics
Adding books by ISBN is much more accurate than adding by author and title and is generally preferred. Please remember you can sometimes find the correct barcode on the inside front cover.

Use this screen to customize the list of styles that will be displayed in your default styles menu. Use the check-box to select which styles will be shown in the list. If no styles are selected, then all styles will be shown. You can re-order the hierarchy by dragging the icon at the extreme right of each row up or down. Long-pressing anywhere else in a row will allow you to edit or clone the details of a specific style. If you cloned a style, and changed your mind, you will need to delete it yourself.

Use this screen to modify the hierarchy of groups for a specific style. Use the check-box to select which groups will be shown in the list and re-order the hierarchy by dragging the icon at the end of each row up or down.
Use this screen to set the default characteristics of all styles. These are used by all built-in styles and as the starting point for any style you define yourself.

Use this screen to set the characteristics of a specific style. You can change the name, edit the groupings to change the hierarchy, and adjust a variety of other preferences to build a style that you find useful.
Import a text file with ISBN numbers. The file should have a single ISBN on each line. The results will be placed in the queue.
If books are shown for every author of the book, they may appear multiple times in the list. Deleting one of those books has the effect of removing all copies from the list.
If books are shown in all series to which the book belongs, they may appear multiple times in the list. Deleting one of those books has the effect of removing all copies from the list.
If you find yourself always rotating camera images in the same direction, try changing the application preferences to specify a rotation to apply automatically.
You can swipe left or right to navigate to other books.
Tapping on a book will show you the details of the book. A long-press on an item in the list will give you more options.
External site links are only processed if the site is actually contacted. As a result the menu “View on…” will likewise only show what is available.
Individual websites can be configured using the settings-icon at the top of the screen.
The title is present in multiple books.
The title is present in a single book.
1st character of the Author family name
Quit and reinsert the correct SD card
Skip to the next book without cover
Allow automatic updates from the internet.
Are you sure you want to continue?
You have unsaved changes, if you exit now they will be lost.

Delete the series “%1$s”?

The books themselves will not be deleted.

Consider editing the series and changing the series name to that of another series to preserve this data.

Delete the publisher “%1$s”?

The books themselves will not be deleted.

Consider editing the publisher and changing the publisher name to that of another publisher to preserve this data.
Delete the bookshelf “%1$s”? The books themselves will not be deleted. They will still be present on any other shelves, or on the “%2$s” shelf.
Really delete the title “%1$s” by %2$s? It will be deleted from all books in which it is listed. The books themselves will not be deleted.
Remove the title “%1$s” by %2$s from this book?

Delete the title “%1$s” by %2$s

How do you wish to apply this change?
Note: The choice “%3$s” cannot be undone!
This will completely delete the book entitled “%1$s” by %2$s.\n\nAre you sure you want to continue?
The bookshelf you are modifying already exists. Would you like to merge them?
The author you are modifying already exists. Would you like to merge them?
The series you are modifying already exists. Would you like to merge them?
The publisher you are modifying already exists. Would you like to merge them?
The book you are trying to add already exists in the database, are you sure you want to add another copy?
This will update the selected fields as shown, but images can optionally be downloaded for ALL books.\n\nDo you want to overwrite all existing images? Warning, this may take a long time.

You have changed:
 “%1$s”
 to
 “%2$s”

How do you wish to apply this change?
Note: The choice “%3$s” will be applied instantly. If you choose “%4$s”, then a new %5$s will be created.
Would you like to send this file as an email?
It is advisable to test this connection to avoid issues later on.
“%1$s” does not exist yet. Should they be created?
All books below this row have covers. Search again from the top?
This will rebuild the sorting data when the app is restarted. Are you sure you want to continue?
This will rebuild the search index data when the app is restarted. Are you sure you want to continue?
This will rebuild the indexes when the app is restarted. Are you sure you want to continue?
This feature requires registration with %1$s. Would you like to see more information?

This feature benefits from registration with %1$s. Would you like to see more information, or disable this message?\n You can find this information at a later date under the “%2$s” section in the settings.
Original title if this book is a translation
Books added or updated since last full backup.
Export of the books to a CSV file
This is only for exporting data; importing is not supported.
A %1$s file called “%2$s” was created in the selected folder and you should manually copy it elsewhere to protect the data in case your device is damaged, lost, or stolen.
Import only new books. Any updates to existing books will be ignored.
Import new books and synchronize existing books based on their last modification date.
Import new books and overwrite existing books. Use this for restoring a backup.
Books deleted on the other device will also be deleted on this device.
Selected fields are visible in the add/edit book screens. Unselected fields are hidden.
Display as given,\ne.g. “The Lord of The Rings”
Move an article at the start of a title to the end,\ne.g. “Lord of The Rings, The”
Beep when a barcode is found
Beep if scanned ISBN is valid
Beep if scanned ISBN is invalid
A cover edit/replace cannot be undone (uses less storage)
A cover edit/replace can be undone (uses more storage)
Resize images each time they are needed (uses less storage, scrolling will be slower)
Cache resized images (scrolling will be faster, uses more storage)
Collect Series info from content table
Resolve author pen-names using the Bedetheque website
Show a button if there is space, otherwise use long-click.

Purgeable files currently use %1$s on the SD card. Log files and other data are saved on the SD card at each upgrade, when you backup the database, or when the application crashes. Tap the button below to purge these files from your SD card. If you have been experiencing crashing or other errors, please consider using the “%2$s” button first.

This will check the deleted-books history from a previous import from another device and synchronization those deletions. In other words, books deleted on the other device will also be deleted on this device.
This will clear the deleted books history. No actual books will be deleted.
Clear the node state for all lists
Book Details shown in the list
Will zoom in on the cover image.
Will open the book details page.
By doing a long-click on a cover image.
Sort on the given names first,\ne.g. “Connie Willis”
Sort on the family name first,\n.e.g. “Willis, Connie”
Display with the given names first,\ne.g. “Connie Willis”
Display with the family name first,\n.e.g. “Willis, Connie”
Selected fields will be updated from the internet. Unselected fields will remain unchanged.
Delete local books which are no longer present on the server
The website is not working as expected.
Track progress in percentage or page number.
Must be larger or equal to the current page
